Title: user input in python
QuestionStr: in c++ you would use "cin >>". in python you would use?
Explanation:
We use "input()" to get user input in python.
You can insert a string as arguement which will be shown as a prompt: "input("Enter input:")".

Title: Functions  in python
QuestionStr: in c++ you would use "return_type function_name( parameter list ){body of the function}". in python you would use?
RightAnswer:
def function_name ( parameter list ):
body of the function
WrongAnswers:
def function_name ( parameter list ):
{body of the function}

def function_name ( parameter list )
{body of the function}

function_name ( parameter list )
{body of the function}
Explanation: in phyton we use the def keyword and it doesnt have return_type
